intro: Leontodon hastilis, commonly known as the hairy bellflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of western Asia. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in grasslands, woodlands, and rocky soils, preferring well-drained conditions. Its flowers are usually blue to purple in color, with hairy stems and leaves that give it its common name. Leontodon hastilis is often found in open habitats and can be an indicator plant for certain soil types.
